item.title: 17 Amazing Health Benefits of Lettuce
item.dc:creator: Bharat Sharma
item.description:
Egyptians were the first to cultivate lettuce (Lactuca sativa). It’s been utilized in Unani medicine for ages to cure a variety of diseases. This nutritious green leafy vegetable is high in antioxidants and critical minerals. Salads, sandwiches, soups, and wraps frequently feature it. item.title: Top 15 Health Benefits of White Pumpkin
item.dc:creator: Bharat Sharma
item.description:
The vegetable pumpkin is a gourd-like squash belonging to the Cucurbita genus and Cucurbitae family. Pumpkins are commonly used to make pumpkin pie, which is a classic Thanksgiving dish in the United States. item.title: Top 8 Health Benefits of Drinking Hot Water
item.dc:creator: Bharat Sharma
item.description:
There are numerous advantages to drinking hot water. Many health-conscious people make it a point to drink warm water first thing in the morning and immediately before bed. What does science have to say about this practice, though? item.title: Top 9 Benefits And Side Effects of Peanut Oil

item.description:
Peanut oil has a wide range of health benefits due to its diverse nutritional content. It is one of the healthiest cooking oils available. Although additional research is needed, it is thought to be low in cholesterol and trans fats. The majority of anecdotal data suggests that the oil is a healthier option. item.title: 10 Amazing Health And Beauty Benefits of Breadfruit
item.dc:creator: Bharat Sharma
item.description:
Breadfruit has numerous health advantages. To begin with, it is botanically a vegetable rather than a fruit. It comes from the mulberry and jackfruit families and comes from a flowering tree named ‘Artocarpus Altillis.’ It has a comparable thick green exterior like jackfruit and a soft golden meaty pulp inside.
